text:
We use the Apache 2.0.45 Proxy Module as Upstreamserver to the Internet. We 
can't display the page "http://www.arp.com/scripts/wgate/ww20/!?
ostore=ECOMM_CH&variant=1&~language=de&~TN=&~TV=&selected_area=&selected_item=&
~ss=&~pp=&~qs=&~customer_no=&~customer_password=&~logo=&~okcode=START
" over the Proxy Module. With a direct connection to the internet or a MS 
Proxy 2.0 everything works fine. The problem is, that the proxy allows no 
dashes ("~")!
creator: thomas.locher@swarovski.com

text:
Hmm. What does it mean "can't display"? Does an error occur? Which error?
How is your proxy configured? Any log entries available?
creator: nd@perlig.de
thomas.locher@swarovski.com
text:
The error message looks like this: "No Service Name Specified - Your request 
did not contain a service name. Please provide a service name as part of the 
URL." or "Session Already Terminated - There is currently no session running 
that might accept this request. This situation usually occurs if your session 
has been closed by the Internet Transaction Server and you tried to navigate 
to a previously requested page by selecting BACK in your browser. To proceed 
you must first restart the session as described above."

Serviceconfiguration:
LoadModule proxy_module modules/mod_proxy.so
LoadModule proxy_connect_module modules/mod_proxy_connect.so
LoadModule proxy_http_module modules/mod_proxy_http.so
LoadModule proxy_ftp_module modules/mod_proxy_ftp.so
LoadModule access_module modules/mod_access.so
All other modules are disabled!

ProxyRequests On
ProxyVia Full
AllowCONNECT 443 444 563
<Proxy *>
    Order deny,allow
    deny from all
    allow from x.x.x.x
Loglevel Notice

There are no log entries with this error - in the logs everything seems to be 
OK!

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
Hmm, these messages are not from mod_proxy, I'd guess they come from the backend
server. The question is now, how are the requests modified by mod_proxy, i.e.
what shows the backend access.log?

I don't have the backend access log, the webmaster told me that their Website 
isn't conform to all standards and they knew that there are problems with some 
proxies. They told me to use an other product - i did this because other pages 
like windowsupdate.microsoft.com also didn't work. Maybe i had a bad 
configuration...
creator: thomas.locher@swarovski.com
